intro: Wahlenbergia akaroa, commonly known as the Akaroa bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, showy blossoms that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
